org.gridgain.grid.cache.store.jdbc
Class GridCacheJdbcBlobStore<K,V>

java.lang.Object
  org.gridgain.grid.cache.store.GridCacheStoreAdapter<K,V>
      org.gridgain.grid.cache.store.jdbc.GridCacheJdbcBlobStore<K,V>
All Implemented Interfaces:
GridCacheStore<K,V>
public class GridCacheJdbcBlobStore<K,V>
extends GridCacheStoreAdapter<K,V>

GridCacheStore implementation backed by JDBC.

Note that this class is intended for test purposes only and it is not recommended to use it in production environment since it may slow down performance. Store that is aware of key and value types should be implemented for production systems.

Store will create table ENTRIES in the database to store data. Table will have key and val fields.

If custom DDL and DML statements are provided, table and field names have to be consistent for all statements and sequence of parameters have to be preserved.

Configuration

Sections below describe mandatory and optional configuration settings as well as providing example using Java and Spring XML.

Mandatory

There are no mandatory configuration parameters.

Optional

  • Connection URL (see GridCacheJdbcBlobStore.setConnectionUrl(String))
  • User name (see GridCacheJdbcBlobStore.setUser(String))
  • Password (see GridCacheJdbcBlobStore.setPassword(String))
  • Create table query (see GridCacheJdbcBlobStore.setConnectionUrl(String))
  • Load entry query (see GridCacheJdbcBlobStore.setLoadQuery(String))
  • Update entry query (see GridCacheJdbcBlobStore.setUpdateQuery(String))
  • Insert entry query (see GridCacheJdbcBlobStore.setInsertQuery(String))
  • Delete entry query (see GridCacheJdbcBlobStore.setDeleteQuery(String))

Java Example

     ...
     GridCacheJdbcBlobStore store = new GridCacheJdbcBlobStore();
     ...

Spring Example

     ...
     <bean id="cache.jdbc.store1" class="org.gridgain.grid.cache.store.jdbc.GridCacheJdbcBlobStore">
         <property name="connectionUrl" value="jdbc:h2:mem:"/>
         <property name="createTableQuery" value="create table if not exists ENTRIES (key other, val other)"/>
     </bean>
     ...


For information about Spring framework visit www.springframework.org

Method Detail

txEnd

public void txEnd(@Nullable
                  String cacheName,
                  GridCacheTx tx,
                  boolean commit)
           throws GridException
Default empty implementation for ending transactions. Note that if explicit cache transactions are not used, then transactions do not have to be explicitly ended - for all other cases this method should be overridden with custom commit/rollback logic.

Specified by:
txEnd in interface GridCacheStore<K,V>
Overrides:
txEnd in class GridCacheStoreAdapter<K,V>
Throws:
GridException - If commit or rollback failed. Note that commit failure in some cases may bring cache transaction into GridCacheTxState.UNKNOWN which will consequently cause all transacted entries to be invalidated.
Parameters:
cacheName - Name of the cache (null for default no-name cache).
tx - Cache transaction being ended.
commit - True if transaction should commit, false for rollback.

load

public V load(@Nullable
              String cacheName,
              @Nullable
              GridCacheTx tx,
              Object key)
       throws GridException
Loads value for the key from underlying persistent storage.

Throws:
GridException - If load failed.
Parameters:
cacheName - Cache name (null for default no-name cache).
tx - Cache transaction.
key - Key to load.
Returns:
Loaded value or null if value was not found.

put

public void put(@Nullable
                String cacheName,
                GridCacheTx tx,
                K key,
                V val)
         throws GridException
Stores a given value in persistent storage. Note that cache transaction is implicitly created even for a single put, so the passed in transaction can never be null.

Throws:
GridException - If put failed.
Parameters:
cacheName - Cache name (null for default no-name cache).
tx - Cache transaction.
key - Key to put.
val - Value to put.

remove

public void remove(@Nullable
                   String cacheName,
                   GridCacheTx tx,
                   K key)
            throws GridException
Removes the value identified by given key from persistent storage. Note that cache transaction is implicitly created even for a single put, so the passed in transaction can never be null.

Throws:
GridException - If remove failed.
Parameters:
cacheName - Cache name (null for default no-name cache).
tx - Cache transaction.
key - Key to remove.
